channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ドナルド・トランプがジョー・バイデンをリードしているという世論調査の執拗な報道は、米国の政治メディアの残念な状態を浮き彫りにし、民主主義への脅威を無視している（Jennifer Rubin/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Jennifer Rubin / Washington Post:
Obsessive coverage of a poll showing Donald Trump leading Joe Biden highlights the sorry state of the US political media and ignores the threat to democracy  —  Last week demonstrated the sorry state of political coverage in this country.  The fixation on early, non-predictive polling …

item.title: 情報源インドのRelianceがThe Pokémon Companyと契約、JioCinemaで1,000以上のTVエピソードと〜20の映画を独占配信、Disneyに対抗（Aditya Kalra/Reuters）
item.description:
Aditya Kalra / Reuters:
Sources: India's Reliance signs a deal with The Pokémon Company to exclusively stream 1,000+ TV episodes and ~20 movies on JioCinema, to compete with Disney  —  The entertainment unit of India's Reliance (RELI.NS) has signed a deal with The Pokemon Company to show children's shows …

item.title: 米報道機関のジャーナリストがイスラエル国防軍に潜入した前例を見て、その倫理性についての議論が再燃している（Edith Olmsted/New Republic）。
item.description:
Edith Olmsted / New Republic:
A look at the precedent of journalists from the US news organizations embedding with the IDF, which has reignited a debate about the ethics of the practice  —  On November 4, CNN broadcast a report on the Israel-Hamas war that was unlike any of its prior coverage: Jeremy Diamond …

item.title: YouTube、DeepMindを搭載した新しいAIツール「Dream Track」を一部のShortsクリエイターにテストさせる。
item.description:
Will Knight / Wired:
YouTube lets some Shorts creators test Dream Track, a new DeepMind-powered AI tool to generate and remix music in the styles of nine artists, including Sia  —  YouTube creators will get to test a new AI tool that generates and remixes music in the style of several famous musicians, including Sia, Demi Lovato, and T-Pain.

item.title: Google Newsは12月18日から有料雑誌のサポートを終了する予定で、ユーザーは停止前に有料雑誌のコピーをエクスポートできるとしている（Ben Schoon/9to5Google）
item.description:
Ben Schoon / 9to5Google:
Google News plans to end support for paid magazines starting on December 18 and says users will be able to export copies of paid magazines before the shutdown  —  A lesser known feature of the Google News app (and the website) is its ability to show digital copies of magazines …

item.title: VoxのEIC兼発行人スワティ・シャルマが、2024年1月よりChronicle of PhilanthropyのEICだったエルバート・ヴェンチュラをエグゼクティブ・エディターに指名（Vox）
item.description:
Vox:
Vox EIC and Publisher Swati Sharma names Elbert Ventura, previously EIC of the Chronicle of Philanthropy, as executive editor starting in January 2024  —  Ventura to oversee the text newsroom to shape rigorous, approachable coverage.  —  Today, editor-in-chief and publisher Swati Sharma announced …

item.title: 中国共産党に関する下院特別委員会のメンバーがティム・クックに、TV+で放送された「The Problem With Jon Stewart」の突然の終了について説明を求める（ロイター）。
item.description:
Reuters:
Members of the The House Select Committee on the Chinese Communist Party ask Tim Cook to explain the abrupt ending of The Problem With Jon Stewart on TV+  —  U.S. lawmakers asked Apple Inc to explain the abrupt end of political comedian Jon Stewart's television show on its streaming service …

item.title: ユニビジョンのニュース部門のトップ・キャスターだったLeón Krauze氏が、同局がトランプ氏により好意的な報道にシフトしたとの報道を受けて退社（Ted Johnson/Deadline）
item.description:
Ted Johnson / Deadline:
León Krauze, a top anchor for Univision's news division, leaves the network after reports that the outlet has shifted to a much more favorable coverage of Trump  —  - Michael Strahan Returns To ‘Good Morning America’ After Time Off Due Personal Family Matters — Update

item.title: オサマ・ビン・ラディンが2002年に書いた米国のイスラエル支援を批判する書簡がTikTokで拡散され、Guardian紙が取り上げる（404 Media）。
item.description:
404 Media:
The Guardian takes down a 2002 letter written by Osama Bin Laden criticizing US support of Israel, after the letter went viral on TikTok  —  “The transcript published on our website 20 years ago has been widely shared today on social media without its original context.  Therefore we have decided to take it down."

item.title: シンガポールを拠点とするCaldecott Music GroupのCEO兼創設者であるMeng Ru Kuok氏が、Bustle Digital GroupからGawkerの商標とドメインを取得。
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Meng Ru Kuok, the CEO and founder of Singapore-based Caldecott Music Group, acquires Gawker's trademarks and domain, but not archives, from Bustle Digital Group  —  Get ready for Gawker 3.0: The twice-shuttered blog site has a new owner, who plans to bring the gossipy pop-culture brand back to life — but not in exactly the same way.

item.title: Pew：米国成人の30％がFacebookから、26％がYouTubeから、16％がInstagramから、14％がTikTokから、12％がXから、8％がRedditから、5％がNextdoorとLinkedInからニュースを定期的に入手している。
item.description:
Sarah Scire / Nieman Lab:
Pew: 30% of US adults regularly get their news from Facebook, 26% from YouTube, 16% from Instagram, 14% TikTok, 12% X, 8% Reddit, and 5% Nextdoor and LinkedIn  —  Facebook may be ready to divorce the news business, but it's still the No. 1 source of news on social media for Americans.

item.title: 欧米の報道機関、イスラエルとハマスの戦争写真の掲載をめぐり厳しい選択に直面、偽情報とフォトジャーナリスト規制で複雑化（New York Times）
item.description:
New York Times:
US and European newsrooms face tough choices over which Israel-Hamas war photographs to publish, complicated by disinformation and photojournalist restrictions  —  Digital disinformation and restrictions on photojournalists have complicated decision-making about the visual chronicle of the Israel-Hamas war.

item.title: FCC、「所得水準、人種、民族、肌の色、宗教、国籍」によるブロードバンド・アクセス制限を防ぐ規則を採択、ISPと米共和党は不満（Ryan Tracy/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Ryan Tracy / Wall Street Journal:
The FCC adopts a rule to prevent limiting broadband access by “income level, race, ethnicity, color, religion, or national origin”; ISPs and the GOP complain  —  Industry and GOP say rule goes too far, warn of a chilling effect on broadband investment

item.title: 調査結果2023年、米国成人の14％がTikTokで定期的にニュースを入手、2020年の3％から増加：18～29歳32％、30～49歳15％、50～64歳7％、65歳以上3％（Katerina Eva Matsa/Pew Research Center）
item.description:
Katerina Eva Matsa / Pew Research Center:
Survey: 14% of US adults regularly get news on TikTok in 2023, up from 3% in 2020: 32% aged 18 to 29, 15% aged 30 to 49, 7% aged 50 to 64, and 3% aged 65+  —  A small but growing share of U.S. adults say they regularly get news on TikTok.  This is in contrast with many other social media sites …

item.title: メモ：BuzzFeed発行人のダオ・グエンが退任し、ジェシカ・プロバスが後任に。
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Adweek:
Memos: BuzzFeed Publisher Dao Nguyen steps down, replaced by Jessica Probus as the company moves from emphasizing its aggregated network to growing its brands  —  Veteran executive Jessica Probus will step up as its new publisher  —  Culture and entertainment publisher BuzzFeed Inc. unveiled …
